name: JW Marriott Starr Pass Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at several resorts in Tucson, and prefer the Omni by far. In contrast with the experienced, welcoming Omni personnel, the JW Marriott is staffed by uncultured, unhelpful youth who are not service-oriented in the least. It doesn't feel high end at all; it feels downright cheesy.
reviews.title: Poorly Staffed Cookie Cutter Convention Center

reviews.text: I called a month before my stay to arrange spa services and to ask for a daily schedule of resort events, and I had to call two more times before anything was ever mailed or confirmed. Excuses were rampant, even from the concierge with whom I'd left detailed voicemails. I decided not to utilize the spa after I realized that they weren't very sophisticated, particularly for their steep price schedule. That ineptitude should have forshadowed what to expect from the stay itself.
reviews.title: A little out of the way, but nicely so

likes.disliked: — Primo's hostess disdain about a solo diner

reviews.text: From the moment you drive up to the seedy valets at the entrance, you feel the inexperience of the hotel personnel. No greeting is extended; it's all about getting tips.
reviews.title: Nice!

reviews.text: At the front desk, a young desk clerk announced that the hotel was full of convention people, hence there were no king rooms except for one next to an elevator with a handicapped walk-in shower and a view overlooking the slamming doors and noisy engines of the valet parking. The walk to the parking lot isn't too bad, and the shuttle comes fairly frequently, but it is indeed a nuisance to be forced to opt to either entrust your rental to a uncouth teen or to be inconvenienced with a walk or shuttle wait. The grounds are so expansive that they could have easily figured in a closer lot or parking garage into the building plan.
reviews.title: Fantastic , Beautiful, Resort!

likes.liked: — Property and rooms are kept exquisitively clean and beautiful.
likes.disliked: — Spa prices could be less expensive.

reviews.text: The rooms are well furnished, the beds are comfortable, and the bathroom sinks have a nice amount of counter space. The afore-mentioned handicapped shower made the experience less desireable. The appointments of the room, including the flat screen TV, are the only positives which the hotel has to offer.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: Snotty. Staff and guests. Would NEVER return. Too bad, because the views are beautiful.
reviews.title: SNOTTY.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW, from entrance to exit, this place is top notch. What a gorgeous resort. It is tucked back away from the hum of city life. It really is a well put together resort. It is a wonderful location to get away from it all. We are from Phoenix and this Tucson retreat was a pleasure to visit.
reviews.title: Awesome Awesome Tucson Resort

likes.liked: — That is is remote and quiet.

reviews.text: The staff is very nice and accomodating. The service was a little slow, but hey we were there to relax and not be rushed. The food at all the locations was very decent. The blossom at the spa has some nice healthy options. The spa was also 5 star all the way around.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - not just for conventions

likes.disliked: — Dirty finger marks on some of the doors!

reviews.text: We plan to revisit this great getaway location. All in all, well worth the money and well worth the trip to visit this quiet beautiful
reviews.title: Great getaway

reviews.text: desert resort.
reviews.title: Beautiful place
Miss it already, definately going back
reviews.text: Lived in Tucson years ago, and have returned many times. Have stayed at Ventana and Omni, both which I liked, but wanted to try the Starr Pass. Glad I did. While its huge convention facilities makes it more suitable for a meeting, I found the room and the service to be wonderful. Driving to the hotel the first night, it had that "wow" factor as it is set in a valley with a mountain backdrop, out on the west side of town in a newly developed residential area. In daylight, the vistas were picturesque. Surrounded by cactus and golf courses, you really feel removed from the city, though in 10 minutes you can reach the interstate. Previous postings complained about aircraft noise. In 48 hours, I heard 2 planes, one of which was military (welcome to Tucson). Service was friendly all around with lots of hellos. Wake up call was on time. Room service was promised in 30-35 minutes, arrived in 20. (Try the french toast). When I opened the closet, it smelled like fresh cut wood. I must of had a new room. Bath was well appointed, but shower pressure was alittle too much. Could certainly hear next room when they had water turned on. TV channel choices a bit limited and movies were $14!!! (Thanks but I'll buy the DVD). All in all I felt comfortable and luxorious without feeling stuffy. Most certainly going back again.

reviews.title: JW Marriott at its best...
reviews.text: This is simply an understated luxurious hotel designed with the feel of the desert. The hotel has all the amenities and comforts one would expect from this type of property. The beds are spectacular...the room temperature is perfectly adjusted. The grounds are extensive as is the hotel which gives you the feel of the openness of the desert. The staff is so accommodating and welcoming. The restaurants are wonderful and next time we hope to enjoy the spa.

reviews.title: Desert Stylish Convention Focused
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a one day convention which was organized and luxurious. Large and comfortable convention halls. Impressive lunch at an outside grassy area with the expansive views of the nearby mountains and desert scenery. Attentive staff and delicious food. Hotel building exterior rather unstylish and nondescript but the common areas of the hotel interior have an expected southwestern decor with stylish Mexican and Native American influences. Large expansive lobby. Ethereal background music. Open-air lounge with gas log firepits and wood burning mexican fireplaces provide a cozy spot to enjoy a starry night with a margarita. Had dinner at Primo (one of the many restaurants on the complex), which was expensive ($30+/entree) but good. Try the homemade canolis...fabulous!! The room was comfortable and good sized. Comfortable leather side chair and dreamy bed with high thread count linens. Large bathroom with granite countertop, spa tub and separate shower with good water pressure and adequate hot water. Room suffered with higher than expected background noise from adjacent rooms. Nice balcony with furniture and great views. Overall, excellent choice for a convention or other organized gathering but less suited for a intimate family vacation or romantic rendezvous. Cab drive from airport 30 minutes about $35. Hotel has private drivers to take you back for the same fee.

This is one of the best, if not THE best, conference orientated hotels I have stayed in. The location is fabulous, with a cleverly designed outside veranda, complete with campfires, overlooking the beautiful desert scenery. A great place to sip a Tequila after dinner. The service was top notch. Upon arriving in my room I found that I was missing a television. Profuse apologies followed together with an immediate replacement. In addition, the maintenance dept. insisted that I accept a free meal at a hotel restaurant of my choice as compensation. The food that I had in the hotel throughout my stay was excellent. My room was large and comfortable with a spacious ensuite marble clad bathroom. Overall, a top class joint with correspondingly top class prices.
reviews.title: Top Marks!

reviews.text: Call me shallow, but the outdoor firepits had me ranking this place as 5-star long before I even saw the rooms or other amenities. It was fabulous nestling down in a big ole' chair with a drink in one hand, a fire at your feet and the night sky above. I'll bet that the other posh resorts in town will pick up on this trick someday soon.
reviews.title: Excellent option in the Tucson Mountains

likes.disliked: — no problems during our trips there

reviews.text: Held a 15 person sales meeting at the JW in Oct. 06. The positives:
reviews.title: Great Place to hold a meeting!

reviews.text: First- this is a meeting/golf hotel, not designed for family. I had mine tag along and was pleasantly surprised:
reviews.title: Fabulous location - fabulous service!

likes.liked: — The staff went the extra mile to be accomodating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - meeting space was great, both days had a deck with a view for breaks
reviews.title: Still in its Freshman year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - FOOD- just great. Had continental breakfast each AM in our room, they brought in fresh bagels, fruit, yogurt, and kept the coffee flowing
reviews.title: Excellent time at the Marriott Starr Pass

reviews.text: -- lunches in the room were fantastic
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a beautiful hotel, in a spectacular location on the west side of town. Yes, it takes a little driving to get to and to get into town to eat etc, but we thought it was well worth it.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!

likes.liked: — Location and the fact the resort was new
likes.disliked: — Pool area was not that attractive and no adult only pool

reviews.text: They have free self-park at the golf course {Covered parking} with a shuttle that runs back and forth to the hotel that runs every 10 minutes.
reviews.title: The best staff ever.

reviews.text: The rooms were really nice. We had requested a king, but they were only able to confirm 2 doubles when we reserved {done the day before}. When we got there, the only king they had available was “accessible” room. We took it and it turned out to be a suite with a really nice sitting area. It wasn’t a city lights view, but that really wasn’t all that important to us. The only real difference was the shower and the closet. Room was comfortable, attractive and had half of the fridge set aside for personal use.
reviews.title: Nice New Resort in Tucson, but some problems...
Primo is fantastic!!
reviews.text: Bed was great…white sheets, duvet, lots of good pillows. Bathroom was really nice with good amenities but no magnifying mirror. Towels were better than Westin, but not great.

The hotel has free “tequila” toast each night at 5:30 pm which is fun. At night, when it “cools off” they open large sliding glass door by the patio and actually light pit fires which is good for atmosphere but does nothing for temps!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.text: Just returned from a wonderful weekend at Starr Pass Resort and Spa.
reviews.title: Awesome Resort!
Beautiful
reviews.text: Absolutely gorgeous, great location, and within short driving distance to downtown and other attractions. Every attention to detail has been taken at this resort. The rooms were elegant and spacey. We especially loved the bathroom, with seperate tub and standup shower. Tile throughout and with alot of extras. Truly 5 Star. The resort is nestled in the foothills of a national park and has their own hiking trails and golf course. The views were amazing from the pool area and from the main lobby. We stayed on the 3rd floor or main lobby area and was very convenient to the elevators and the lobby. We spent most of our time in the pool area that is very well laid out. The pool is a split level with a smaller kids area on top and lower level for the adults. We never had a problem getting a chair and just really enjoyed the atmosphere there. They played background music and the pool staff was always accomodating. I can't say much for the restaurants except the Plunge which is the pool side bar, we ordered snacks most afternoons. This is a resort and items on the menus are pricey. Most evenings we went into town to enjoy the local flavor and many great authentic mexican restaurants. I would recommend Mi Nudito off of 6th and 22nd. Be prepared for a wait because the food is that good. They are locally owned and are always busy. The staff at the Pass was the most accomodating and pleasurable experience of our entire vacation. We always felt we were the only ones there and were always taken care of; from the valet to house keeping. Everyone had a smile and always greeted you. Two thumbs up for the JW Marriott Starr Pass. We hope to return sometime soon.

Perfect service, clean rooms, fun activities, and comfortable with the children. Loved the show put on by a local wildlife showman with his animals and local creatures. The view you can't beat. The resort is located up in the mountains between canyons and overlooks the city lighgts at night. We even saw mule deer out our balcony on the golfcourse at sundown. The restaurnat food was great and even had a starbucks for coffee. Thumbs up!!!
reviews.title: Nice Stay at Starr Pass
Luxury Resort With Expensive Extras
reviews.text: We just came back from a weekend stay at the JW Marriott Starr Pass in Tucson. Although our stay was short, we were extremely satisfied with this hotel. Everything was perfect. The rooms were very clean and pleasant and the staff was friendly and courteous. Although the pool area was a bit smaller than what I was hoping for, nonetheless, we still had a fantastic time. We're definitely coming back.

reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here with our 11 and 15 year old children and we had a great time. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to serve you. No problems with the valet parking, they were very efficient and we never had to wait long. The rooms were a bit small for what you paid, just 2 double beds, a leather chair and a small desk but the bathroom was large and very nice. Make sure you ask for a room with a view. We only ate at the hotel once because the restaurants were expensive. The pool was plenty big and not crowded at all, considering it was spring break. The outdoor bar and firepit area were really nice, especially in the evening. You have to get down there on time for the complimentary tequilla shots at sunset because it happens really quickly. I wanted to use the spa but it was really expensive. We played tennis next door at the country club, had to pay $20 for 1 hour and the courts were not in the best shape. We really enjoyed hiking the trails by the resort. Highly recommend eating dinner at Mi Nidito, the best Mexican food and it's less than 15 minutes from the resort but allow at least a 1 hour wait for dinner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dates of stay Sept 6-Sept 8 2006 There is only 2negative things to say about the Starr Pass Resort. First is the noise from the airplanes. The hotel is right in the flight path of the Tucson airport even though it is not close to the airport. Every evening about 5:00 PM the planes started flying in and didn't end until late in the evening. You could hear them from our room and definitely from the balcony. This is something to consider if you are sensitive to noise.
reviews.title: Great hotel but lots of airplane noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second negative is the parking situation and the taxes charged by the City of Tuscon. You must either pay $15.00/day for valet or park down the hill and take a shuttle which is very inconvient. I realize the hotel can't control the taxes charged by the City but they are very high.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.disliked: — Prices of burgers at the poolside restaurant

reviews.text: We loved the hotel. The room was wonderful. Bedding is comfortable. Room was clean.
reviews.title: Loved it - highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool area is spacious and well kept up. Hot tub was HOT.
reviews.title: A Very Nice Hotel
Love this place! Love this place!
reviews.text: Incredible views from back patio/pool area.

aka: Jw Marriott Starr Pass Resort And Spa
description: JW Marriott Starr Pass Resort and SpaEnjoy the mountains of Arizona at JW Marriott Starr Pass Tucson Resort & Spa. Located just west of an area considered the birthplace of Tucson, AZ, this resort hotel is rich with culture, history and beauty. Experience a truly unique destination resort complete with world class spa facilities and nationally acclaimed Arizona golf courses. Fine dining and award winning restaurants further complement this one of a kind Tucson resort hotel.
